forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 68 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 13 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks in Downtown San Francisco, the air carries the crispness of an overnight cloud cover, which blankets the city, leading to a tranquil ambiance that shoos away the chaos of the city streets just awakened. These clouds are a gentle reminder of the marine layer softly embracing the coast, gathering its moisture before the sun begins to pry open the morning sky. As you stroll through the still hushed streets, you might feel the cool touch of a west-southwest breeze, nudging you into a light jacket while you sip warm coffee, witnessing the world ease into a day where clarity waits just beyond the horizon.

By the afternoon, expect a transformation—the sun will coax the clouds, lifting them into wispy strands that temporarily relinquish their grip on the glimmering skyline. Although the warmth will rise close to 70 degrees, it will gradually mellow to a comfortable 68, ensuring the charm of an inviting fall day. The winds will pick up, swirling around you with spirited gusts, encouraging a casual wander down to your favorite café or a stroll along the waterfront. A good pair of light layers will serve you well, making it easy to shift from the brisk air to pockets of warmth. Engage with the vibrant energy of the city as it comes alive, perhaps indulging in the pleasures of an outdoor market or pausing to enjoy the delicate dance of sailboats on the bay, a fitting way to celebrate a day that promises to shine brightly within the embrace of San Francisco’s gentle climate.
